014package org.jdbi.v3.sqlobject.customizer.internal;
015
016import java.lang.annotation.Annotation;
017import java.lang.reflect.Method;
018import java.lang.reflect.Parameter;
019import java.lang.reflect.Type;
020import java.util.Arrays;
021import java.util.List;
022import java.util.Objects;
023
024import org.jdbi.v3.sqlobject.customizer.DefineList;
025import org.jdbi.v3.sqlobject.customizer.SqlStatementCustomizerFactory;
026import org.jdbi.v3.sqlobject.customizer.SqlStatementParameterCustomizer;
027import org.jdbi.v3.sqlobject.internal.ParameterUtil;
028
029public final class DefineListFactory implements SqlStatementCustomizerFactory {
030
031    @Override
032    public SqlStatementParameterCustomizer createForParameter(Annotation annotation,
033                                                              Class<?> sqlObjectType,
034                                                              Method method,
035                                                              Parameter param,
036                                                              int index,
037                                                              Type type) {
038        final DefineList d = (DefineList) annotation;
039        final String name = ParameterUtil.findParameterName(d.value(), param)
040                .orElseThrow(() -> new UnsupportedOperationException("A @DefineList parameter was not given a name, "
041                        + "and parameter name data is not present in the class file, for: "
042                        + param.getDeclaringExecutable() + "::" + param));
043
044        return (stmt, arg) -> {
045            List<?> argsList;
046            if (arg instanceof List) {
047                argsList = (List<?>) arg;
048            } else if (arg instanceof Object[]) {
049                argsList = Arrays.asList((Object[]) arg);
050            } else if (arg == null) {
051                throw new IllegalArgumentException("A null object was passed as a @DefineList parameter. "
052                        + "@DefineList is only supported on List and array arguments");
053            } else {
054                throw new IllegalArgumentException("A " + arg.getClass() + " object was passed as a @DefineList "
055                        + "parameter. @DefineList is only supported on List and array arguments");
056            }
057            if (argsList.isEmpty()) {
058                throw new IllegalArgumentException("An empty list was passed as a @DefineList parameter. Can't define "
059                        + "an empty attribute.");
060            }
061            // Uses stream match, cause the Java 9 ImmutableList implementation throws an NPE if asked `contains(null)`
062            if (argsList.stream().anyMatch(Objects::isNull)) {
063                throw new IllegalArgumentException("A @DefineList parameter was passed a list with null values in it.");
064            }
065
066            stmt.defineList(name, argsList);
067        };
068    }
069}
